root: ^Can I help you? (She peeks through the cateye on the door)
^All due respect sir, it's late night. May I ask who you're looking for?
^Doctor Elethea. We need a word with her.
^... I'll get her for you. I'll be back shortly.
^There's a few knights outside that want to speak to you.
^(It hurts... My stomach... It's so warm... I can't... move...)
^A pity, really. Bidding farewell in the position that you are. But then again, this isn’t the first and won’t be the last time I see one of these types of goodbyes.
^(Sniffs.) Who… who’s… speaking? Is this god? Am I dead?
^Don’t compare me to those imbeciles. I’m merely an observer, stumbling on your fate by chance.
^… Perhaps I was too harsh. You won’t die yet, for now.
^You feel it too don’t you, the slow fade of emotions and life away from your body. That’s soul magic. They can’t harvest it when you’re dead.
^The same that is happening to you.
^The few who can hear my voice have only one thing in common: a strong will, or a grudge to resolve.
^I will give you a choice You can either stay here and fade away, or embrace the worst of reality.
^Crawling back up, she finds a poorly bound book and takes the sword of a knight who had suddenly fell to the floor.
^Looks like I have to fight my way through.
^Scouring about the rubbles left behind by the knights and monsters, Ithma suddenly stumbled on something.
^Blood seeps out between the rubbles and the one lone foot sticking out from the ground.
^Can you save them? Please... Like you did me...
^I'm only capable of lending my power to those still in this world. I'm afraid that... I am unable to do so.
^Ithma tries to stand up, only to find more heartbreak.
^(... I gave this pendant to Penelope last year. She never takes this off.)
^Then you must know what this means.
^Why would anyone do this. We never did anything against the Kingdom of Atroceus.
^The King wants soul magic, and his troops will serve his wish.
^Why? What could he possibly not have already?
^Eternal life, uncomprehensible magical power, yet that matters not one bit now does it.
^There is one, other way. An eye for an eye a tooth for a tooth. Use the same magic as the King.
^...What good will living forever do. I have nothing left.
^...I've never said it was to live forever. Due to my influence in the past hours there should be a book and a rapier that emerged on you.
^Perform it using that rapier. Kill your enemies.
^When you finish collecting enough souls, this land will be no more. At the flick of your fingers.
^I'll be no different to the King.
^Then that is the price you must pay for revenge.
^... And nothing like this will ever happen again.
